Profile.name: Pattawee Puangchit
Profile.label: PhD Candidate | Trade Researcher
Profile.summary: PhD Candidate in Agricultural Economics with extensive experience in data analytics, international trade policies, and CGE modeling. Recipient of the prestigious Anandamahidol Foundation Scholarship. Lead analyst for World Bank-funded research on U.S. Trade Policies.

work.name: Center for Global Trade Analysis (GTAP), Purdue University
work.summary: Conducting research on international trade policies using CGE models, specializing in GTAP-Standard and GTAP-HET models to analyze economic implications of trade policies.
highlights: Led analysis for World Bank-funded research on U.S. Trade Policies (Tariff War) using CGE Model ($30,000 funding)
Contributing to GTAP 11 Data Base development
Developing dynamic approaches to model Non-Tariff Measures in ASEAN region

work.name: AMATA Production Co., Ltd.
work.summary: Leading data analytics operations for company strategy and decision making.
highlights: Developing analytics frameworks for business optimization

work.name: University of California, Davis
work.summary: Served as teaching assistant for Welfare Analysis of Agricultural Policies course with Professor Julian Alston.
highlights: Facilitated student learning in economic welfare analysis

work.name: Unilever Thailand
work.summary: Participated in Future Leaders' Program, working with the Food Retail Team (Knorr) to analyze market data and consumer trends.
highlights: Applied data-driven insights to market strategy
Analyzed consumer behavior and retail trends

work.name: True Corporation Public Company Limited
work.summary: Analyzed business data to support strategic decision-making and identify growth opportunities.
highlights: Conducted market analysis for telecommunications sector
Developed reporting dashboards for executive decision-making

description: Dissertation: Incorporating Non-tariff Measures to Dynamic CGE Model
Focus on international trade policies and computational general equilibrium modeling
Thesis: The Impact of the ASEAN Economic Community on Agricultural Trade
Specialized in international trade and economic integration

awards.title: Anandamahidol Foundation Scholarship
awards.summary: Highly prestigious and fully-funded scholarship ($60,000 per year), awarded annually to fewer than six exceptional scholars per year for graduate studies abroad, with no repayment required.

awards.title: Distinguished Alumni
awards.summary: Recognition for outstanding achievements and contributions as an alumnus.

awards.title: Valedictorian
awards.summary: Highest academic honor awarded to the top graduating student.

awards.title: Outstanding Student Awards: Role Model Students
awards.summary: Awarded to less than 1% of students who have won all outstanding awards.

awards.title: Bhumibol Adulyadej Scholarship
awards.summary: National merit-based scholarship of $1,500 awarded to exceptional students.

working_papers.name: Modeling Non-Tariff Measures on ASEAN Region: A Dynamic-GTAP CGE Model
Impacts of Non-tariff Measures on ASEAN Trade: A Dynamic Approach
working_papers.note: Presented at The 27th GTAP Annual Conference

working_papers.name: The Impact of the ASEAN Economic Community on Agricultural Trade: Synthetic Control Method
Chapter 12.B Disaggregating labor payments
working_papers.note: In Global Trade, Assistance, and Production: The GTAP 11 Data Base, edited by A. Aguiar
